Even considering that I moved to a different timezone shortly after the accident, I still felt that I was able to easily communicate with them about any questions or concerns I was having (they respond with most efficiency to email in my experience).

During negotiations with the other party (which lets face it, thats the part all of us care about the most) I was shocked by how willing this practice was to work with us and help us obtain the settlement we needed to finally put this ugly event behind us. While I sincerly hope that I am never in another situation that would call for it, I would happily use this law firm again and/or refer them to any friend or family member in need of legal representation.

text: I first met April Bauder at legal aid in Birmingham. April was kind and compassionate and patient. I started off my divorce without a lawyer, as the husband made me all kind of promises, and I believed him. You know the saying " fool me once, shame on you, fool me 7639 times.....", well..... things got ugly, and I saved my quarters, dimes, and nickles, worked harder, and on Jan 23, 2018 I hired Miss April Bauder. Why? You don't  fake kindness, that is something  you are taught. You don't fake compassion, that is something you feel. People with handicaps are treated "different", and April has never treated me different. She ALWAYS returns my calls, and last, her laughter! She has this infectious,  contagious  BEAUTIFUL laughter!!!!  The last few months have been sorrowful, painful, and soooo much hurt. I could cry til the sun goes down, April calls me and I giggle, and giggle and giggle! Proverbs 17:22 "a cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones." (NIV)  AND Leah Thomas? Well, somewhere is a storage unit, there is a sparkling little tiara, for her, and she will be the guest of honor at my next pool party! Thank you, thank you thank you, April. If it wasn't for your volunteer work, I would of never found you. Grateful  for the Merrell Law Firm, and what it produces out of it's  people, for people like me who are struggling.... Linda Lee Ponziano Bradford

name: Hanna Patterson
text:
Had no complaints at first. Not from Alabama, never been in trouble. Never needed an attorney. Got a “drug paraphernalia” charge for a grinder/pipe 🙄 coming home from Florida vacay. They called back in a timely manner, lowered the fee of one bc we were a “package deal” in which I very appreciate HOWEVER he changed my “defendents statement” after we had already signed. Including information that was false and incorrect. He was a solid 30 minutes late for court. So after having falsified court documents, I called him to get them changed or corrected and his response was that the DA needed what the paraphernalia was so “maybe he should have ran it by us”, it didn’t matter, he couldn’t do anything, and the judge already signed off on it. Then upon exiting the court offered to walk us out just to ask for a review on Google. He was pretty easy to talk to, which was the only thing I had to really say until I saw my falsified documents.

‼️UPDATE‼️: MISUNDERSTANDING WAS CORRECTED AND BRIAN MADE SURE THE DOCUMENTS WERE CORRECTED ON BOTH ENDS AND CONTACTED ME IMMEDIATELY WITH FILED/APPROVED CORRECTIONS. I highly recommend using his services! ‼️UPDATE‼️

resp.text: Thank you Hanna. I assure you I had no intent to falsify anything. It was an honest mistake and I’m happy I could help get everything straightened out for you. Best wishes!

name: Frank Page
text: In 2012 Mr Dasinger was court appointed to me in a criminal case, I never once met with him,spoke to him, nothing until my court date. I wrote many letters, and my family made many calls to no response. The day of court, he had no idea who I was or anything about my case. All he had to say was the state is sending you to prison and to accept it cause that was my only option. I was young, scared, and had no idea what to do. He on the other hand, played on fb, laughed it up with the states attorney, and my victim. My first and only felony, poss of forged instrument, two checks for less than $50, got me 3 yrs. I got more help from the inmates sitting next to me that day than I got from him. He did NOTHING in my deffense. I do honestly believe the outcome would have been less severe if I had paid him cash, or if I had went with a diffrent lawyer. It has been many years and I do hope he has grown as a lawyer and person since then, but I would not recommend him.

resp.text: Unfortunately, when I held a contract with the State of Alabama as an appointed attorney, I did not have the time to meet with all of the 100+ new clients that I was appointed to represent each month. The numbers were simply overwhelming and impossible to keep up with.  I have not handled court appointed work since 2013 because I wanted to be able to give more personal attention to all of my clients, which I am now able to do.  I'm deeply sorry that I couldn't have helped you more Frank.  I hope all is going well and I wish you a prosperous 2019.

name: Lewis McCluer
text: I'm involved in a landlord-tenant dispute and realized I was over my head and needed help. I contacted the Powell Law Firm and got a consultation with Thomas that day. He was very attentive and professional and let me know my options in plain, no nonsense terms. He also let me know that the firm was always available should the matter get to the point that representation became necessary. When I had further questions as the situation progressed, I called back, but was unable to reach Thomas immediately, as he was in court that day. I left a message with their front desk,  and received a call back from Melvin later that day as Thomas was still in court. He listened intently and further advised me as what I needed to do, and even returned another call in regards to my issue. Both Thomas and Melvin were extremely helpful in what was to me new territory as I had never been in a situation like this before. They stood ready to assist any way they could to include retaining their services should the need arise. As a retired Marine with 26 years service I know professionalism when I see it. Hope I don't need to retain an attorney for this current situation but I have full confidence in them should that need arise. I highly recommend that you contact them in the event you fell you may need the services of an attorney/

name: Lisa Edwards
text: I had a 10am appointment to see Mr. Thomas today. It was the worst meeting i have ever had with this company. The young lady at the front desk was more interested in talking to her friend on the phone then greating me when i walked in. after standing there for a few minutes i was told to go have a seat in another room to wait again. as I'm waiting i can hear Mr. Thomas instructing another young associate to go and tell someone to do something and make sure they get it done because that was his money. I'm pretty sure that conversation should not have been discussed in front of a potential client. As I am sitting there explaining to Mr. Thomas why I am there seeking hes services he was more interested in picking the sores on his leg then paying any attention to anything i had to say, and while he was showing me the bruises from his recent jet ski accident all he could tell me was to seek an attorney immediately. I believe that's what I am here. What he ment was i needed a court appointed attorney because I could not afford him. So with Very unprofessional! My family has dealt with Powell Law firm for many years my aunt has know Mr. Thomas sence hes graduation year in 07. They have been wonderful people always willing to help with a smile. till now. So with no help from Mr. Thomas all I can do now is sit back and hope a friend doesn't pass away in lockup because she has a rare condition that causes her to have seizures. I am so disappointed in the actions of Mr. Thomas and the rudeness of the employees at Powell Law Firm.

text: She will steal your money and never even show up for court. I was not the client, she made that perfectly clear but she dropped my son for NO REASON AT ALL after he paid her $4800

resp.text: Ms Hanke, was not the client. Her adult son was a client. She has made false allegations. It is important to know that when one who is not a client, posts on a review, it is not based on the complete occurrences of the representation as she was not the client and was not privy to all the information. In addition, when she did not get all the information she wanted about the case--attorney client privilege exists to protect the client--she asserted defamatory statements in a public forum. When the client is noncompliant, or is unwilling to pursue certain avenues of a case, the mother of an adult child becomes irritated by outcomes rather than considering the reason for the outcomes. Perhaps one should remember who the client is and that Mom's and Dad's can't make adult children act in a manner for which they want despite the desire to pay for representation. Paying for representation does not guarantee results and does not grant the person paying free access to the information in a case.

name: Cindy-Rae Jones
text: Deepti Asthana has been our attorney since 2014. In the span of only four years, she has untangled three complicated estates which overlapped one another as the decedents were also one another's heirs.  Her counsel has been very helpful to both our dying family members and to those of us left behind. Dee processes all the legal twists and turns of an issue and  straightens it all out to protect the interests and liabilities of the decedents, their heirs and the estate representatives. As the trustee to one estate, executor to another, and administrator & realtor for the other estate, I have had to rely heavily on Dee's continued counsel and guidance, which has been impeccable. Staying on top of complex matters, while grieving the loss of family members, can get tricky and overwhelming at times, and important documents can be missed. But with Dee's wonderful paralegal, Debbie, always on top of everything, I never worry that I will make a mistake that will injure someone. Debbie calls and texts me when I need to sign documents or pay expenses, and she keeps me and the process up-to-date and always moving forward to closure. These two women have guided and walked our family through the most complex time of our lives, and I recommend them to everyone I know who needs a really sharp estate attorney with a smart, on-the-ball paralegal. I must add that if there is a time you need an attorney to fight for you, if you don't choose these ladies, just pray that the entity you need protection from hasn't chosen them.  As nice as they are, when it comes to protecting their clients, they don't play.

name: Mark Davis
text:
Austin, an exceptionally qualified attorney, has represented my best legal interests since 2013. Austin has always gone well above and beyond his required legal duty to protect my rights. I have personal knowledge of Austin doing the same for others.

Austin - accurately - will defend unwarranted legal filings made by opposing corrupt attorneys, he will file accurate legal filings without unnecessarily creating additional strife in your personal life all the while protecting your legal rights, he will personally drive across the state of Alabama for jailed clients working to obtain their freedom, he will call out injustice and attempt to correct it, and he knows - and gets - Constitutional law (a rarity in Alabama).

If Alabama had more attorneys like Austin working to protect citizen’s legal interests in doing what is right rather than lining pockets and making legal friendships our state would be a better place to live.

If you want to retain an effective attorney that will work timely and efficiently to protect your rights, Austin is the attorney to retain.

/s/ Mark Davis
Florence, Alabama

Hopefully I never have any use for him again but if I'm ever in a bad way again he'll definitely be my first call.

name: JW Wryta
text: I am a male 37 year old honor discharged protected veteran who holds a Masters Degree and has never had any issues with the law prior to my DUI in 2017.  While my charges were from 2017, I was not arrested until 2019 because I was sent to the hospital on the date of the offense instead of jail and diagnosed with Sudden Traumatic Shock exasperated by alcohol.  Being arrested was completely out of the norm for me.  I did not know where to begin, what to expect, and was consistently imagining the worst possible outcomes and scenarios.  Based off my charges, my bail agent highly recommended that I contact Mr. Crumbly for counsel.  I had an initial meeting with Mr. Crumbly within a week from the first time I contacted him.  The initial meeting did not take longer then an hour and during that time Mr. Crumbly was able to explain all my available options to include representation options, payment options, court expectations, and expected timelines.  Perhaps the most beneficial thing Mr. Crumbly discussed in the initial meeting was the overall stress of the situation.  He told me that it was human nature to imagine the worst possible outcomes and to not worry about that as it was him and his teams job to make sure those outcomes don’t happen.  He was absolutely right and ,during the entire course of my case, I constantly imagined the worst possible scenarios; however, I always made myself think back to that initial conversation with Mr. Crumbly and remembered that is why he is there.  After that initial meeting, Mr. Crumbly and his team handled everything for 6 months up until my court date with the Judge.  Before I even had to go before the Judge, Mr. Crumbly had secured a deal with the DA for me to enter the Pre-Trial Intervention Program (PTIP) and have charges dropped following the completion of the program.  I was more than happy to enter PTIP as it took all uncertainty and stress off the table and I was able to hold everything going forward in my own hands.  As of May 2020, I have successfully completed the PTIP program and am currently working with Mr. Crumbly on having my charges expunged.  I am very pleased with the services I have received from Mr. Crumbly and his team and would highly recommend them.  While I am not going to put personal information on here for obvious reasons, Mr. Crumbly has my full permission to give my number to prospective clients who would like a recommendation.

name: Greg Kaltz
text:
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN-

In March of 2014 I was charged with a DUI in Madison County, Alabama. This led to several serious concerns I had as to what negative impacts this DUI might have regarding maintaining my current place of employment, a valid Alabama Driver’s License, and the potential for increased auto insurance rates. In addition, I was uninformed of all the specific issues pertaining to Alabama State Law as they apply to a DUI charge especially, with respect to possible fines, imprisonment, unknown future adverse impacts, or establishment of an unfavorable permanent criminal history. The level of stress in my daily life was extremely high, to say the least, due to this situation and these concerns.

I was referred to the Law Office(s) of Russell W. Crumbley to try and sort all these issues out. Russell put me immediately at ease and clarified for me, in a no-nonsense way, what needed to be done to effectively address the DUI charge against me. He also kept me informed as to the current status of my case as it made its way through the Alabama judicial process and provided reassuring personal representation at any and all court scheduled hearings or appointments. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND retaining Russell as your DUI Attorney should you ever find yourself in a similar situation. He is a completely knowledgeable and competent attorney in the area of Alabama DUI Criminal Law and you can rest assured that he will obtain the best possible outcome regarding your case.

Sincerely Yours-

Greg Kaltz

P.S. – Due to Russell’s expertise, he obtained a DISMISSAL of the DUI charges against me! He is also handling a follow-on expungement action for me that will clear my Alabama arrest record for DUI.

resp.text: Greg: It was a pleasure. Thank you! ~ Russell

name: Brock Grayson
text: Mr. Russell Crumbley took good care of my DUI case and was an expert in all things considered. He took the stress out of my hands and life and handled everything in a professional manner. On a Sunday, he was the only office that took my phone call, I had to be at court the next day after my arrest at 8 AM. Every office was closed, including Crumbley's. However, on his website there was a chat option in which he took my request and talked to me personally. On that very Sunday he met with me within an hour. He was on his way back from Tuscaloosa and still met with me! I've never been so stressed, but after meeting with Mr. Crumbley, he assured me I would be taken care of. The results: My case was nolle prossed: thrown out. All I had to do was sit back, and relax while Russ took care of the rest. If you want positive results, do yourself and stress level a favor and call his office and have him represent you. You will not regret it.

There are options in this town. We tend to appreciate those people who choose us. Again, THANK YOU! ~ Russell

name: Refinnej
text:
Mr. Crumbley has been extremely helpful a couple times for me.  His office has been helpful and detail oriented to ensure that we knew everything that was going on and kept me up to date every step of the way.  They were always friendly and accommodating.  Even while not representing me, he was able to give me some great advice about my father's will and estate after my father had passed away.  He took the time out of his busy day to tell me what I needed to do and who it would be that I needed to find and contact once it went to probate.  This is not his area of expertise, he was just helping me know where to start.  He explained to me the process.   Since it was a large city that my father lived in, it was a while before the estate went to probate and I assumed I had been written out due to my father's controlling sister so I didn't bother looking into it until 2 years later when I was found by a life insurance company and received a letter explaining that I was the beneficiary of a policy.  I then took Mr. Crumbley's advice by finding the attorney through the probate court and found that I had many savings bonds, which the sister told me had been spent 10 years prior.  The executrix allegedly told the attorney that she tried to contact me, but she did not  Thanks to these cushions I have been able to go back to school.

I want to add, if anyone is in legal trouble, please seek counsel.  The DA will lie straight to your face.  The DA will threaten you with the highest jail terms to get you to plead guilty so they don't have to take it to trial.  Their in house legal assistants that are there to help guide defendants will tell you that if you don't take the plea "deal" that you wont win.  They are only there to help the DA, not you.  It's very difficult, especially when it's your word against law enforcement officers, many who have no problem lying in court and they're buddies with the judge.  You need someone who knows the law and knows how the courts work.  It wont be free, but it's worth it to not have to go to jail and/or have a record haunting you.  For more serious crimes, you may get a public defender, but your life is on the line with someone who may not care about you or what happens to you.  It's a dangerous risk to take and once you are convicted, it's harder to find people to listen to you.

resp.text: How kind of you. Thank you. What a mountain of burden you had going on in your life. Thanks for letting us help you navigate through it. ~ Russell

name: Cheryl Mellema
text:
Mr. Crumbley’s office called me the day after I posted my review of his partner, and asked if I would speak with Mr. Crumbley at his office. When I explained I was busy I was asked if I would speak with him over the phone. I agreed and I was transfered to Mr. Crumbley.  After listening to me explain my why I left the review and my account of my interactions with Mr. Matt Wisda, Mr. Crumbley asked me several questions.
1. Would I consider removing my review?
2. Would I consider moving it to Mr. Wisda’s webpage?
3. If he (Crumbley) were to fire Mr. Wisda would I then delete my review! I said no.
4. Was there ANYTHING he (Crumbley) could say or do that would result in me removing the review? To which I responded “Not ethically”, because I felt he was trying to “lead me” into asking for a monetary resolution.

During our discussion Mr. Crumbley stated he was not at all happy about Mr. Wisda’s conduct. And that he was considering actions (including termination).  He asked once more if there was anything he could do To get me to retract the review against “Crumbley, Blackwell, & Wisda Lawfirm”.  I explained to him that when I researched Divorce Attorneys/Firms I based my decision in part on the reviews of his Firms website and information regarding the lawyers and therefore would not consider removing the review. We said goodbye and I hung up.

I spent that day wondering if he would call again. I just knew “IT” wasn’t over.
So this evening I checked on my review out of curiosity...and wouldn’t you know it there is this long drawn out explanation that it was I who was misinformed etc.  Never once mentioning any unethical behavior on behalf of Mr. Wisda!
I want to SHOUT from the highest rooftops what a sleazy slimeball you are! Shall I post more? Shall I post information Mr. Wisda freely disclosed to me about a clearly VERY SENSITIVE divorce and custody battle where the children involved had been...!
You disgust me!

I retained Matt Wisda to represent me for my divorce.  I feel he acted unethically.
I contacted his office after receiving an invoice for services that were not rendered. When I followed up with an appointment a few days later not only did he begin by talking about another case he had been working on (this was the 2nd time he mentioned details of this other party's case!) but he also presented me with an official Settlement Agreement" that clearly stated me and my spouse had both agreed to - WHICH NEITHER OF US HAD!

We never went through discovery at all! No mediation - nothing!
The entire document looked copy and pasted, and all of the assets and then some were to be awarded to me!

Mr. Wisda was trying to fool me into thinking he had been hard at work on my case and that I was entitled to everything when in fact he hadn't done anything. Additionally It was never my intention to try take my husband to the proverbial cleaners. I just wanted a fair settlement.

I didn't even look at the "Settlement Agreement" he'd drawn up while at his office. I had already decided to sever our business agreement and told him so.  I asked when I could pick up my remaining retainer and he said it would be about a week.

When I went to pick up the monies, enclosed with my check was an invoice of almost $700 for the bogus "Settlement Agreement" that had been drawn up without consultation or discovery.  Coincidentally the new invoice showed just one line item for the preparing of said agreement which was dated after the phone call I mentioned above.

I immediately drew up a letter refusing to pay and insisting I be refunded.  Additionally in the letter I called him out for trying to fool me and get paid for it. I emailed this letter and received a response early the next morning stating they would immediately refund the that money, which they did.

I am leaving this review to make others aware.  In our consultation meeting he told me his practice "is like a game to me."  And because  conducting his business in such a way, I feel, is an abuse of his power as an attorney and is extremely unethical.

resp.text:
We deeply regret that your experience with our office did not meet your expectation. We work very hard to not let that happen. Having said that, you say that you received a “settlement agreement” that indicated you and your husband had agreed to the settlement terms when, in fact, you had not agreed. You also say that this agreement was put together without doing any “discovery” or any “mediation”. You initially hired Mr. Wisda to assist you in negotiating an uncontested divorce with your husband’s lawyer. In fact, you produced, for us, a “settlement agreement” created by your husband’s lawyer when you hired Mr. Wisda. That settlement agreement had already been prepared absent any “discovery” or attempt to “mediate”. It was clearly the intentions of both parties (and their lawyers) to settle this matter, if possible, without costly litigation. This type divorce typically does not involve “discovery” (in the traditional sense) and most certainly doesn’t involve “mediation”. In these type matters we simply go with settlement negotiations to the extent we are able, which necessarily includes “settlement proposals”. Also, in this type situation, both parties tend to agree that they know what the assets are and their values are not in dispute.

The “settlement agreement” your husband’s attorney prepared, and gave you, was just like the one Mr. Wisda gave you. In reviewing your husband’s proposal it is noted that it also includes language stating that the two of you “acknowledged and agreed” to things that you had not already agreed upon. In other words, both lawyers settlement agreements included the very same language in that regard. In fact, most paragraphs in all settlement agreements are full of language such as “the parties acknowledge and agree …”. This language is included to satisfy legal requirements and applies to you ONLY AFTER you have actually read it, agreed to it and signed it. It is not intended to mean that you have already seen it and agreed to it. And, it is NEVER INTENDED to deceive. Your attorney, Matt Wisda, did exactly what your husband’s lawyer did with respect to that language.

As far as the “attempt to fool you” is concerned: you received an itemized statement of the charges. You received two billing statements. The second of those two seems to be where you objected. That statement involves the “settlement agreement”. You were dissatisfied with that charge and objected to that bill and, although you had NOT notified him of your desire to terminate him until after that work was done, we refunded every penny to you of that part of the bill. And your objection, as much as any we can tell, is founded on your belief that it included the “bogus” settlement language indicating that you and your husband had agreed to the terms that you had not agreed to.

We strive to handle cases the way our clients direct us. And, while the services you received were not satisfactory to you, Mr. Wisda DID NOT bill you for services not rendered. His conduct was not unethical. His ability to communicate effectively with you, I will agree, must have missed the mark. For example, we are not sure how, exactly, you did not understand that the “acknowledged and agreed” language in the settlement agreement did not mean you had both already agreed to that agreement. That was no more the intent of what Mr. Wisda provided you than it was the intent of what your husband’s attorney provided him. It was merely two lawyers doing their jobs and adding the language that was going to be necessary at some point, in advance. Perhaps THAT is why it looked copied and pasted.

We would encourage ANYONE who is dissatisfied in ANY way, with ANYONE in our office, to meet with any of us. WE ARE ALWAYS AVAILABLE to meet with that person and do everything we can to alleviate their concern and fight for your cause. Your case matters to us. And, YOU matter to us. Best wishes moving forward during this trying time.

~ Russell Crumbley & Matt Wisda

I found Mr. Crumbley's office and the charges ended up being dropped/dismissed. Him and his team, even the front office, they were all excellent. Couldn't have asked for a better outcome. Now my life, my clearance and my job will remain in tact. Everyone has the blurb at the end of their advertisements saying "no representation is made that the quality of legal services performed is greater than that of other lawyers" but I'm not sure I agree with that. Mr. Crumbley really knows what he's doing and takes the time to understand where your coming from, what you are trying to do, and came up with a fantastic plan to get me there. Thanks again, to the whole office and team at Crumbley, Blackwell, Wisda and Asc.

There are, however, occasions when people do not wish to hire us (for one reason or another) or even schedule an appointment to come meet with us. Under those scenarios, our staff gives the best information they can (given the limited engagement over the phone) to help them resolve their own issues. Other than that, there is very little an attorney can do for that person. If you feel you have been dealt with less than fairly I would invite you to communicate your concerns with me by emailing me directly at russ@crumbleylaw.com. Leave your phone # and I will be glad to call you and see if I can give you a better answer than the answer you received earlier this week. resp.text: Wow! I have fought for clients for 21 years but, as far as I know, this is the first time a client has fought for me. I never really thought about clients reading other people's reviews before they write their own but I guess they do. I think you were more upset than I was. But, I have learned over the years that people see things, view things, expect things and interpret things differently from each other. As they say: "one man's trash is another man's treasure". EVERYTHING must be ALWAYS viewed with the proper perspective. I appreciate your strong, heartfelt words but they weren't necessary. We take cases all across the board and that includes cases that are very difficult and filled with a multitude of considerations, possibilities and opportunities - even for failure. Sometimes the absolute best outcome still falls short of the perfect outcome. I think most people understand that. Having said that, God Bless you young man. Many thanks! ~ Russell

name: mike money
text: I retained Mr. Crumbley to represent me on a DUI in the city of Madison. I had heard a lot of good things about him and his firm from other people that had used his services. I scheduled a consultation and went to meet Mr. Crumbley. I was very nervous about my situation, but within minutes he had me at ease and feeling confident we would win this case. During our meeting, Mr. Crumbley was very professional and knowledgeable and easy to talk to. I followed his advice and we took the case to a jury trial in the higher court. We were scheduled court dates several times and each time I went, the court wasn’t able to try the case at that time and would reschedule at a later date. Jump forward 6 years (that’s our court system), and the court finally scheduled a court date. So since it had been 6 years, I had moved a couple of times so the court didn’t have my current address so I was never notified of the new date. Mr. Crumbley still appeared in court on my behalf, he informed the court that he had tried to contact me but was unable to reach me. The court was talking about doing several different things, but Mr. Crumbley kept fighting on my behalf to reach a solution that was in my best interest. The day after my court date, I had a missed call, I called the number and it was Mr. Crumbley’s office. His staff found out who had tried to contact me, next thing I know, Mr. Crumbley was on the phone. He told me about the missed court date, and I’m thinking Ok, bench warrant!!! He continued to tell me the news….Case is Dismissed!!! What better outcome could there be. Thanks Russell.

resp.text: Mike: THANK YOU for that. But, I just did what you hired me to do ... I kept fighting. And, it certainly worked out better than I expected. Just goes to show ... you never know until you go try. God Bless!

text: I am definitely giving Dean Waite and his office 5 stars. He was beyond everything we were looking for in an accident attorney. He asked if we could meet and when I told him we were in the hospital he said I will be there soon. He visited us in the hospital on a Sunday afternoon and immediately treated us like family. We went over our case and he immediately accepted it. He was in contact with us every other day or so which gave us piece of mind know he was actively working our case. After a couple of weeks we were told the Insurance company was denying our claims for the accident. We thought we had lost he case and we couldn’t do anything else. Dean worked for a few days on trying to get our claim accepted and finally after a few days it was approved. Dean is the nicest and most professional attorney I’ve met. text: We were hit by a school bus, which resulted in a 4 surgery case. Tabatha, an associate of Mr. Waite told my husband and me we were old and they wouldn't be able to get us much in our case, because we had existing physical problems. I guess they don't think us, 60 year olds deserve  to be treated like the victims of a school bus running a stop sign and causing, over $14,000 worth of damage to our vehicle, deserve compensation for our injuries. I would not recommend them if you are older, not sure how they treat younger people. We went with a different law firm, which was probably the best thing for us.

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Croston,

I was disappointed to see this review on Google, especially since in June 2018 we received an email from you reading "Thank you. We appreciate your hard work." I'm not sure why you have reversed course now, but I would like to take a moment to respond.

I proudly represent people of all ages and from all walks of life, and my firm and I have gotten great results for many older clients. Every case is different, and every situation has pros and cons. Part of my job as an attorney and counselor at law is to advise my clients of all factors, both positive and negative, that may affect their claims. In injury cases, age and medical history are among those factors.

We discussed with you the factors that would affect your case, as we would with any other client. While we are always cognizant of the sensitivity of these issues, in my experience, being up front and frank with my clients is the way to provide better representation and better results.

Please feel free to call me at (251) 265-1000 to discuss this matter further. I wish you the very best of luck.

Sincerely,
Attorney Dean Waite

I had multiple questions ranging from money to get my stitches removed to whether I needed to obtain a police report and wanted only to speak to the staff member in charge of my case.  Before I could finish saying my name to the receptionist, Dean exited his office and greeted me. And although he had a meeting in 20 minutes & i offered to just ask a staff member, he wouldn't leave until all of my 5 or 6 questions were personally answered.  4th, Attorney Derek Siebert, in charge of my case, did a phenomenal job for me.  He contacted me multiple times to explain my options & offer opinion if I desired. He was truly in my corner for me.  Lastly, but very very impressive to me, every member of Dean's staff i had any interaction with treated me with great courtesy & with professionalism.  I felt very & truly cared for as a client.  I wouldn't recommend any one else.
